title: Identify What We Are Looking For
text: We are looking for the cost of the shirt. We also do not know the cost of the sweater.
speech: We are looking for the cost of the shirt. We also do not know the cost of the sweater.
pacedSpeech: We are looking for the cost of the shirt. We also do not know the cost of the sweater.

title: Name What We Are Looking For
text: Choose a variable to represent that quantity. Let $$n=the$$ cost of the shirt. Let $$m=the$$ cost of the sweater.
speech: Choose a variable to represent that quantity. Let  n is equal to, t h e,  cost of the shirt. Let  m is equal to, t h e  cost of the sweater.

title: Translate into a System of Equations
speech: 3  shirts and  2  sweaters cost $114:  3 n plus 2 m is equal to 114 .
pacedSpeech: sweaters cost $114:   3 n plus 2 m is equal to 114

title: Translate into a System of Equations
speech: 2  shirts and  4  sweaters cost $164:  2 n plus 4 m is equal to 164 .
pacedSpeech: sweaters cost $164:   2 n plus 4 m is equal to 164

title: Solve the System of Equations
text: To solve the system of equations, use elimination. The equations are in standard form. To get opposite coefficients of $$m$$, divide the second equation by $$-2$$.\n$$3n+2m=114$$\n(2*n+4*m=164)/-2
speech: To solve the system of equations, use elimination. The equations are in standard form. To get opposite coefficients of  m , divide the second equation by  negative 2 .\n 3 n plus 2 m is equal to 114 \n(2*n+4*m=164)/-2

, divide the second equation by   negative 2
.  3 n plus 2 m is equal to 114

title: Eliminate a Variable
speech: Add the two equations.\n 3 n plus 2 m is equal to, 114 \n negative n, minus 2 m is equal to negative 82
pacedSpeech: Add the two equations.  3 n plus 2 m is equal to, 114
negative n, minus 2 m is equal to negative 82

title: Solve for $$n$$
text: $$m$$ will be eliminated and then solve for $$n$$.\n$$2n=32$$\n$$n=16$$
speech: m  will be eliminated and then solve for  n .\n 2 n is equal to 32 \n n, is equal to 16
